column1: There was once upon a time a Queen who had the ugliest little baby imaginable
column4: that it was almost impossible to believe he was a little boy at all.A fairy
column6: assured his mother that the little baby would be very good and clever
column7: saying that she was also giving him a gift which would enable him to make that person whom he loved the best as clever as himself.This somewhat consoled the Queen
column8: but still she was very unhappy because her son was so ugly
column9: though no sooner had he begun to speak than he could talk about all sorts of things
column10: and he had such pretty ways that people were charmed with him.I forgot to say
column12: when he was quite a baby
column13: he had a funny little tuft of hair on his head
column14: so he was called Tufty Riquet
column15: for Riquet was the family name.
